prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 1. HCN (4-3), CS (7-6) and HCO (4-3) imaging at 0.05'' res
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations in the extended configuration with Band 7 will be used to trace relative distributions and kinematics of the dense star forming molecular gas and star formation activity. The HCN, CS and HCO+ lines will be observed simulataneously with a single frontend/correlator setup.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 100:1 per beam to image both the HCN and HCO+ lines emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. Since there will be some emission from both lines and dust on the scale ~2 arcsec we request compact configuration coverage also. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. This resolution is waht is justified given the expected velocity dispersion of the turbulent nuclear gas based on our Cycle 0 line fitting.

In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. Therefore, don't worry if you see incorrect line frequencies. This Science Goal inlcudes CS 7-6 and continuum measurement in the LSB and HCN 4-3 and HCO+ 4-3 in the USB.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. In the worst case scenario if this doesn't get scheduled, we should be able to achieve much of the 50mas science goal with the Band 6 data. But the Band 7 high resolution imaging is highly desirable for a full multi-level excitation analysis at high resolution in the Arp 220 disks.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 2. CO (3-2) and CS (7-6) imaging at 0.04'' res
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations in the extended configuration with Band 7 will be used to trace relative distributions and kinematics of the dense star forming molecular gas. The CO (3-2) and CS (7-6) lines can be observed simulataneously with a single frontend/correlator setup.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 30 - 100:1 per beam to image both the CO and CS lines emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. Since there will be some emission from both lines and dust on the scale ~2 arcsec we request compact configuration coverage also. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. This resolution is waht is justified given the expected velocity dispersion of the turbulent nuclear gas based on our Cycle 0 line fitting.

In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. Therefore, don't worry if you see incorrect line frequencies. This Science Goal inlcudes H13CN 4-3 and CO 3-2 in the LSB and 2 continuum bands in the USB.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out tospatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. In the worst case scenario if this doesn't get scheduled, we should be able to achieve much of the 50mas science goal with the Band 6 data. But the Band 7 high resolution imaging is highly desirable for a full multi-level excitation analysis at high resolution in the Arp 220 disks.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 3. CO2-1, 13CS 5-4 and 12CS 5-4 imaging at 0.04'' res
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations in the extended configuration with Band 6 will be used to trace relative distributions and kinematics of the dense star forming molecular gas. The CO (2-1), 13CS (5-4) and CS 5-4 lines can be observed simulataneously with a single frontend/correlator setup.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 50:1 per beam to image CO line emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. Since there will be some emission from both lines and dust on the scale ~2 arcsec we request compact configuration coverage also. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. This resolution is waht is justified given the expected velocity dispersion of the turbulent nuclear gas based on our Cycle 0 line fitting.

In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. Therefore, don't worry if you see incorrect line frequencies. This Science Goal inlcudes CO 2-1 and 13CS 5-4 in the LSB and CS 5-4 plus a continuum band in the USB.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. In the worst case scenario if this doesn't get scheduled, we should be able to achieve much of the 50mas science goal with the Band 6 data. But the Band 7 high resolution imaging is highly desirable for a full multi-level excitation analysis at high resolution in the Arp 220 disks.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 5. CO 1-0 Imaging at 0.1'' res
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations in the extended configuration with Band 3 will be used to trace relative distributions and kinematics of the dense star forming molecular gas. The CO (1-0) and continuum will be observed.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 50:1 per beam to image CO line emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. Since there will be some emission from both lines and dust on the scale ~2 arcsec we request compact configuration coverage also. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. This resolution is waht is justified given the expected velocity dispersion of the turbulent nuclear gas based on our Cycle 0 line fitting.

In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. Therefore, don't worry if you see incorrect line frequencies. This Science Goal inlcudes CO 1-0 and a continuum band in the USB and two continuum bands in the LSB.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. In the worst case scenario if this doesn't get scheduled, we should be able to achieve much of the 50mas science goal with the Band 6 data. But the Band 7 high resolution imaging is highly desirable for a full multi-level excitation analysis at high resolution in the Arp 220 disks.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 6. 13CO and C18O 1-0 at 0.1'' res
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Observations in the extended configuration with Band 3 will be used to trace relative distributions and kinematics of the dense star forming molecular gas. The 13CO and C18O 1-0 lines will be covered.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 10-20:1 per beam to image 13CO line emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. Since there will be some emission from both lines and dust on the scale ~2 arcsec we request compact configuration coverage also. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. This resolution is waht is justified given the expected velocity dispersion of the turbulent nuclear gas based on our Cycle 0 line fitting.

In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. Therefore, don't worry if you see incorrect line frequencies. This Science Goal inlcudes CS 2-1 and a continuum band in the LSB and 13CO and C18O 1-0 in the USB.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.
We recognize that the highest resolution (50mas) Band 7 observations may be tricky to schedule for the RA of Arp 220. In the worst case scenario if this doesn't get scheduled, we should be able to achieve much of the 50mas science goal with the Band 6 data. But the Band 7 high resolution imaging is highly desirable for a full multi-level excitation analysis at high resolution in the Arp 220 disks.

The angular resolution is set by the largest available in Cycle3 since we are attempt to fully resolve the nuclear disks which are 50 - 25 mas in radius. There is emission extended out to spatial scales ~2 arcsec which will be recovered in the requested compact configuration.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: 13CO and C18O 1-0 at 0.4'' res

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request typical SNR 10-20:1 per beam to image 13CO line emission at detect the isotopologues at reduce SNR dependening on the optical depth of the emission. The velocity resolution of 100 km/s will give ~9 indendent velocity images on the source. In all cases we have selected the maximum BW correlator setting and then adjusted the line rest frequencies so that the spectrometers overlap slightly but at the same time provide the maximum total frequency coverage. prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose ultra-high resolution (50uas, 20pc) imaging of Arp 220, the closest, brightest and best studied ultra-luminous IR galaxy (ULIRG). Our observations in the CO(1-0), (2-1) and (3-2), HCN(4-3), CS(7-6),(5-4) and (2-1) (all with their 13C isotopologues) and the dust continuum will resolve the gas structures and dynamics in the two (hypothesized) nuclear disks of this archetypical ULIRG. The observations will also place significant constraints on possible SMBHs. Indeed, our cycle 1 observations of Arp220 (Scoville et al. 2015), together with our extensive simulations, demonstrate that such extremely high fidelity observations are feasible, that will result in resolutions that exceed previous ULIRG observations by orders of magnitudes in beam area. Tracing a number of key diagnostic lines of the ISM will shed unprecedented insights in the inner workings of this prototypical ULIRG (gas densities, masses, outflows, gas dispersions), that hosts some of the most extreme star formation environments in the universe, both at low and high redshifts. Compact and extended configurations are requested to provide the required image fidelity at the superlative resolution of ALMA.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: 2011.0.00175.S Mergin IR Luminous Galaxies - Arp 220 and NGC 6240 N. Scoville 2011.0.00097.S Evolution of the ISM Contents of Massive Galaxies at z = 2.2 to 0.3 N Scoville 2013.1.00111S The Extreme UV through ALMA's Eyes N Scoville 2013.1.00034.S Evolotion of ISM in Star Forming Galaxies at z = 1 to 5 N. Scoville
prp:ObsProposal.prp:keyword: Luminous and Ultra-Luminous Infra-Red Galaxies (LIRG & ULIRG)
